jcsp.win32

Class NTService

  • java.lang.Object
    • jcsp.win32.NTService
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpawnerServiceNT, TCPIPCNSServerNT
    Deprecated. 
    no longer required with more modern windows operating systems

    public abstract class NTService
extends java.lang.Object

    Abstract class for declaring an NT service. A Java implementation of a service must declare the startService and stopService methods. startService must run the actual service and must block until the service is ready to terminate. For example it may sit in a loop servicing requests. stopService will be called when startService is expected to stop blocking and return. The stopService method should return promptly. Any time consuming shutdown code should be done asynchronously (for example in the startService thread) before startService returns.

    For example:

     public class MyService extends NTService {
   boolean running = true;
   protected void startService () {
     while (running) {
       System.beep ();
       Thread.sleep (1000);
     }
   }
   protected void stopService () {
     running = false;
   }
   private MyService () {
     super ("MyService");
   }
   public static void main (String[] args) {
     new MyService ().run ();
   }
 }
    Author:
    Quickstone Technologies Limited

    • Field Detail

      • serviceName

        private final java.lang.String serviceName
        Deprecated. 
        The name of the service as registered with the NT dispatcher. This really ought to be unique.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NTService

        protected NTService(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new NT service wrapper with the given name. This name ought to match the name that is registered with the NT service manager but probably will work if it doesn't. What is more important is that the name is system unique.

    • Method Detail

      • startDispatcher

        private int startDispatcher()
        Deprecated. 
        Registers a callback function from the DLL with the NT dispatcher and starts the service.

      • waitForStart

        private void waitForStart()
        Deprecated. 
        Blocks inside the DLL until the NT service dispatcher is ready to start the service. This is because the threads allocated by the NT service dispatcher cannot directly call a Java method because there is no valid JNI environment for them.

      • waitForStop

        private void waitForStop()
        Deprecated. 
        Blocks inside the DLL until the NT service dispatcher is ready to stop the service. This is because the threads allocated by the NT service dispatcher cannot directly call a Java method because there is no valid JNI environment for them.

      • acknowledgeStop

        private void acknowledgeStop()
        Deprecated. 
        Notifies the NT service dispatcher that the stop has completed and the service has terminated. It is quite possible that the JVM could terminate abruptly (ie do an equivilant of a System.exit) once this method has been called.

      • prepareSemaphores

        private void prepareSemaphores()
        Deprecated. 
        This must be called prior to any of the other methods to initialize the semaphores maintained internally by the DLL.

      • startService

        protected abstract void startService()
        Deprecated. 
        This will be called when the service is started and must block until the service completes.

      • stopService

        protected abstract void stopService()
        Deprecated. 
        This will be called when the service is stopped and the startService method must terminate.

      • run

        protected final void run()
        Deprecated. 
        Runs the service, registering it with the NT service dispatcher. If there is a problem this will terminate the JVM with the Windows error code. If all is okay, this will never return. All subsequent processing is done by the allocated StarterThread and StopperThread objects and threads internal to the DLL.
